description: Telnyx is a VoIP telecom service provider, providing a cloud-based platform that offers access to carrier grade voice services over the internet.

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: This method is called every time a Telnyx webhook event occurs
steps: You can add a webhook using by inserting url to proper fields

blocks.name: getCallerInformation
blocks.description: Returns the caller information (if found) for a telephone number

args.name: number
args.info: The requested telephone number in E.164 format, may or may not begin with "1"

blocks.name: getLRN
blocks.description: Gets LRN object

args.name: number
args.info: The requested telephone number in E.164 format, may or may not begin with "1"

blocks.name: getExtendedLRN
blocks.description: Gets ExtendedLRN object

args.name: number
args.info: The requested telephone number in E.164 format, may or may not begin with "1"

blocks.name: getMessagingProfiles
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to get messaging profiles associated with your Telnyx account.

blocks.name: createMessagingProfile
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to create a new messaging profile, required for SMS-capable numbers.

args.name: url
args.info: Url of the webhook. You can use our service as webhookUrl. https://webhooks.rapidapi.io/api/message/Telnyx/webhookEvent/{projectName}/{projectKey}. See details above

args.name: failoverUrl
args.info: Failover url of the webhook. You can use our service as webhookUrl. https://webhooks.rapidapi.io/api/message/Telnyx/webhookEvent/{projectName}/{projectKey}. See details above

blocks.name: getSingleMessagingProfile
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve a messaging profile associated with your Telnyx account.

blocks.name: updateMessagingProfile
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to update a messaging profile associated with your Telnyx account.

args.name: url
args.info: Url of the webhook. You can use our service as webhookUrl. https://webhooks.rapidapi.io/api/message/Telnyx/webhookEvent/{projectName}/{projectKey}. See details above

args.name: failoverUrl
args.info: Failover url of the webhook. You can use our service as webhookUrl. https://webhooks.rapidapi.io/api/message/Telnyx/webhookEvent/{projectName}/{projectKey}. See details above

blocks.name: generateMessagingProfileSecret
blocks.description: To send messages from one of your numbers, you must authenticate using the unique secret/token that is on the associated messaging profile. Use this endpoint to generate a new secret.

blocks.name: getMessagingProfileSmsTNs
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve a list of SMS-enabled numbers associated with a messaging profile on your Telnyx account.

blocks.name: getMessagingProfileTNs
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve a list of numbers to associate with one of your messaging profiles.

args.name: hasMessagingProfile
args.info: Only show numbers associated with a messaging profile

blocks.name: deleteMessagingProfile
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to delete a messaging profile from your Telnyx account.

blocks.name: getTNMessagingSettings
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to get the settings for one of your SMS-enabled numbers.

args.name: number
args.info: The number in e164 format (without the plus sign)

blocks.name: updateTNMessagingSettings
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to update the settings for one of your SMS-enabled numbers.

args.name: number
args.info: The number in e164 format (without the plus sign)

blocks.name: getActiveSendRequests
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to expose information about active outbound requests.

blocks.name: sendSMS
blocks.description: Use this endpoint to send a message from an SMS-enabled number.

args.name: profileSecret
args.info: This is the unique, private secret/password belonging to the from numberâ€™s messaging profile.

args.name: from
args.info: The source number, in e164 format. This number must be attached to a messaging profile.

args.name: to
args.info: The destination number, in e164 format.

blocks.name: listAddresses
blocks.description: Returns all Addresses the user has access to

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of results to load

args.name: includeNonAddressBook
args.info: Filter to indicate if addresses not in the address book should be shown

blocks.name: createAddress
blocks.description: Create an Address

args.name: addressBook
args.info: Indicates if the address should be considered part of your 'address book' or not; addresses that are in your address book are shown by default when listing addresses, those not in your address book are not.

blocks.name: getSingleAddress
blocks.description: Gets a single Address based on the ID supplied.

blocks.name: updateAddress
blocks.description: Update a single Address based on the ID supplied.

args.name: addressBook
args.info: Indicates if the address should be considered part of your 'address book' or not; addresses that are in your address book are shown by default when listing addresses, those not in your address book are not.

blocks.name: deleteAddress
blocks.description: Delete a single Address based on the ID supplied.

blocks.name: listConnections
blocks.description: Returns all Connections the user has access to

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of results to load

args.name: withIps
args.info: Specify as true to include authorized IPs along with connections

args.name: withAuth
args.info: Specify as true to include credential authentication details along with connections. Please note this only affects connections for which the authorization type is credential-based authentication.

args.name: withFQDNS
args.info: Specify as true to include FQDN / domain details along with connections. Please note this only affects connections for which the authorization type is FQDN-based authentication.

args.name: mode
args.info: Optional parameter to specify typeahead mode. Doing so limits the amount of details returned but speeds up calls.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Specify an ordering for the results.

args.name: sortDirection
args.info: The sort_direction specifies in which way the ordering of the connections is applied.

args.name: filterConnectionName
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, connections with at least a partial match will be returned. Matching is not case-sensitive. Requires at least three characters.

args.name: filterIpAddress
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, only connections with one or more matching authorized IP addresses will be returned.

args.name: filterAuthUserName
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, only connections of credential-based authentication will be returned, and only those with a user_name that is at least a partial match with the value provided. Requires at least three characters.

blocks.name: createNewConection
blocks.description: Create new connection

args.name: timeout1xx
args.info: Time(sec) before aborting if connection is not made (min: 1, max: 20)

args.name: timeout2xx
args.info: Time(sec) before aborting if call is unanswered (min: 1, max: 600)

args.name: aniOverrideType
args.info: Specifies when we apply your ani_override setting. Only applies when ani_override is not blank.

args.name: aniOverride
args.info: Set a phone number as the ani_override value to override caller id number on outbound calls

args.name: transportProtocol
args.info: One of UDP, TLS, or TCP. Applies only to connections with IP authentication or FQDN authentication.

args.name: thirdPartyControlEnabled
args.info: Applies to calls sent TO this connection.

args.name: privacyZoneEnabled
args.info: By default, Telnyx does not send caller-id information when the caller has chosen to hide this information. When this option is enabled, Telnyx will send the SIP header Privacy:id plus the caller-id information so that the receiver side can choose when to hide it.

args.name: codecs
args.info: Defines the list of codecs that Telnyx will send for inbound calls to a specific number on your portal account, in priority order. This only works when the Connection the number is assigned to uses Media Handling mode: default. OPUS and H.264 codecs are available only when using TCP or TLS transport for SIP

args.name: prackEnabled
args.info: Enable PRACK messages as defined in RFC3262

args.name: defaultRoutingMethod
args.info: Default routing method to be used when a number is associated with the connection.

args.name: defaultPrimaryAuthorizedIpId
args.info: The default primary IP to use for the number. Only settable if the connection is of IP authentication type. Value must be the ID of an authorized IP set on the connection.

args.name: defaultSecondaryAuthorizedIpId
args.info: The default secondary IP to use for the number. Only settable if the connection is of IP authentication type. Value must be the ID of an authorized IP set on the connection.

args.name: defaultTertiaryAuthorizedIpId
args.info: The default tertiary IP to use for the number. Only settable if the connection is of IP authentication type. Value must be the ID of an authorized IP set on the connection.

args.name: anchorsiteOverride
args.info: "Latency" directs Telnyx to route media through the site with the lowest round-trip time to the user's connection. Telnyx calculates this time using ICMP ping messages. This can be disabled by specifying a site to handle all media.

args.name: encryptedMedia
args.info: Enable use of SRTP or ZRTP for encryption. Valid values are those listed or null. Cannot be set to non-null if the transport_portocol is TLS.

args.name: instantRingbackEnabled
args.info: When set, ringback will not wait for indication before sending ringback tone to calling party.

args.name: t38ReinviteSource
args.info: This setting only affects connections with Fax-type Outbound Profiles. The setting dictates whether or not Telnyx sends a t.38 reinvite. By default, Telnyx will send the re-invite. If set to `customer`, the caller is expected to send the t.38 reinvite.

args.name: aniNumberFormat
args.info: This setting allows you to set the format with which the caller's number (ANI) is sent for inbound phone calls.

args.name: isupHeadersEnabled
args.info: When set, inbound phone calls will receive ISUP parameters via SIP headers. (Only when available and only when using TCP or TLS transport.) Defaults to false.

args.name: encodeContactHeaderEnabled
args.info: Encode the SIP contact header sent by Telnyx to avoid issues for NAT or ALG scenarios

args.name: inboundGenerateRingbackTone
args.info: Generate ringback tone through 183 session progress message with early media

args.name: outboundGenerateRingbackTone
args.info: Generate ringback tone through 183 session progress message with early media

args.name: dtmfType
args.info: Sets the type of DTMF digits sent from Telnyx to this Connection. Note that DTMF digits sent to Telnyx will be accepted in all formats.

args.name: outboundLocalization
args.info: A 2-character country code specifying the country whose national dialing rules should be used. For example, if set to `US` then any US number can be dialed without preprending +1 to the number. When left blank, Telnyx will try US and GB dialing rules, in that order, by default.

blocks.name: getSingleConnection
blocks.description: Gets a single connection based on the ID supplied.

blocks.name: updateConnection
blocks.description: update a single connection based on the ID supplied.

args.name: timeout1xx
args.info: Time(sec) before aborting if connection is not made (min: 1, max: 20)

args.name: timeout2xx
args.info: Time(sec) before aborting if call is unanswered (min: 1, max: 600)

args.name: aniOverrideType
args.info: Specifies when we apply your ani_override setting. Only applies when ani_override is not blank.

args.name: aniOverride
args.info: Set a phone number as the ani_override value to override caller id number on outbound calls

args.name: transportProtocol
args.info: One of UDP, TLS, or TCP. Applies only to connections with IP authentication or FQDN authentication.

args.name: thirdPartyControlEnabled
args.info: Applies to calls sent TO this connection.

args.name: privacyZoneEnabled
args.info: By default, Telnyx does not send caller-id information when the caller has chosen to hide this information. When this option is enabled, Telnyx will send the SIP header Privacy:id plus the caller-id information so that the receiver side can choose when to hide it.

args.name: codecs
args.info: Defines the list of codecs that Telnyx will send for inbound calls to a specific number on your portal account, in priority order. This only works when the Connection the number is assigned to uses Media Handling mode: default. OPUS and H.264 codecs are available only when using TCP or TLS transport for SIP

args.name: prackEnabled
args.info: Enable PRACK messages as defined in RFC3262

args.name: defaultRoutingMethod
args.info: Default routing method to be used when a number is associated with the connection.

args.name: defaultPrimaryAuthorizedIpId
args.info: The default primary IP to use for the number. Only settable if the connection is of IP authentication type. Value must be the ID of an authorized IP set on the connection.

args.name: defaultSecondaryAuthorizedIpId
args.info: The default secondary IP to use for the number. Only settable if the connection is of IP authentication type. Value must be the ID of an authorized IP set on the connection.

args.name: defaultTertiaryAuthorizedIpId
args.info: The default tertiary IP to use for the number. Only settable if the connection is of IP authentication type. Value must be the ID of an authorized IP set on the connection.

args.name: anchorsiteOverride
args.info: "Latency" directs Telnyx to route media through the site with the lowest round-trip time to the user's connection. Telnyx calculates this time using ICMP ping messages. This can be disabled by specifying a site to handle all media.

args.name: encryptedMedia
args.info: Enable use of SRTP or ZRTP for encryption. Valid values are those listed or null. Cannot be set to non-null if the transport_portocol is TLS.

args.name: instantRingbackEnabled
args.info: When set, ringback will not wait for indication before sending ringback tone to calling party.

args.name: t38ReinviteSource
args.info: This setting only affects connections with Fax-type Outbound Profiles. The setting dictates whether or not Telnyx sends a t.38 reinvite. By default, Telnyx will send the re-invite. If set to `customer`, the caller is expected to send the t.38 reinvite.

args.name: aniNumberFormat
args.info: This setting allows you to set the format with which the caller's number (ANI) is sent for inbound phone calls.

args.name: isupHeadersEnabled
args.info: When set, inbound phone calls will receive ISUP parameters via SIP headers. (Only when available and only when using TCP or TLS transport.) Defaults to false.

args.name: encodeContactHeaderEnabled
args.info: Encode the SIP contact header sent by Telnyx to avoid issues for NAT or ALG scenarios

args.name: inboundGenerateRingbackTone
args.info: Generate ringback tone through 183 session progress message with early media

args.name: outboundGenerateRingbackTone
args.info: Generate ringback tone through 183 session progress message with early media

args.name: dtmfType
args.info: Sets the type of DTMF digits sent from Telnyx to this Connection. Note that DTMF digits sent to Telnyx will be accepted in all formats.

args.name: outboundLocalization
args.info: A 2-character country code specifying the country whose national dialing rules should be used. For example, if set to `US` then any US number can be dialed without preprending +1 to the number. When left blank, Telnyx will try US and GB dialing rules, in that order, by default.

blocks.name: deleteConnection
blocks.description: Deletes a single connection based on the ID supplied.

blocks.name: createConnectionCredentials
blocks.description: Sets the connection given by connectionId to use credentials-based authentication. This will remove any other authentication type set for the connection.

args.name: connectionUsername
args.info: Username that will be sent when using the connection. Must be globally unique. Case-insensitive.

args.name: connectionPassword
args.info: Password that will be sent when using the connection. Must be at least 8 characters or more in length.

blocks.name: updateConnectionCredentials
blocks.description: Update the credentials used for authenticating the connection given

args.name: connectionUsername
args.info: Username that will be sent when using the connection. Must be globally unique. Case-insensitive.

args.name: connectionPassword
args.info: Password that will be sent when using the connection. Must be at least 8 characters or more in length.

blocks.name: getConnectionCredentialsSuggestion
blocks.description: Get a suggestion for a username and password for use when creating a credentials authentication record for the connection given by connectionIds.

blocks.name: setConnectionFQDNAuth
blocks.description: Sets the connection given by connectionId to use FQDN-based authentication. This will remove any other authentication type set for the connection. Please note that domains themselves are not added through this endpoint.

args.name: connectionUsername
args.info: Username that will be sent when using the connection. Must be globally unique. Case-insensitive.

args.name: connectionPassword
args.info: Password that will be sent when using the connection. Must be at least 8 characters or more in length.

args.name: ipAuthenticationMethod
args.info: The method of authentication to use if this FQDN auth strategy uses IP-based outbound. Defaults to "tech-prefix". Has no effect if this auth strategy uses credentials for outbound authentication.

args.name: fqdnOutboundAuthentication
args.info: The method of authentication to use for outbound calls on this authentication strategy. Defaults to "credential-authentication".

blocks.name: updateConnectionFQDNAuth
blocks.description: Update the credentials used for authenticating the connection given

args.name: connectionUsername
args.info: Username that will be sent when using the connection. Must be globally unique. Case-insensitive.

args.name: connectionPassword
args.info: Password that will be sent when using the connection. Must be at least 8 characters or more in length.

args.name: ipAuthenticationMethod
args.info: The method of authentication to use if this FQDN auth strategy uses IP-based outbound. Defaults to "tech-prefix". Has no effect if this auth strategy uses credentials for outbound authentication.

args.name: fqdnOutboundAuthentication
args.info: The method of authentication to use for outbound calls on this authentication strategy. Defaults to "credential-authentication".

blocks.name: listFQDNs
blocks.description: Returns all FQDNs the user has access to

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of results to load

blocks.name: createFQDN
blocks.description: Creates a new FQDN.

args.name: dnsRecordType
args.info: the DNS record type for the FQDN. For cases where a port is not set, the DNS record type must be 'srv'. For cases where a port is set, the DNS record type must be 'a'. If the DNS record type is 'a' and a port is not specified, 5060 will be used.

blocks.name: updateFQDN
blocks.description: Updates a single FQDN based on the ID supplied

args.name: dnsRecordType
args.info: the DNS record type for the FQDN. For cases where a port is not set, the DNS record type must be 'srv'. For cases where a port is set, the DNS record type must be 'a'. If the DNS record type is 'a' and a port is not specified, 5060 will be used.

blocks.name: deleteFQDN
blocks.description: Deletes a single FQDN based on the ID supplied

blocks.name: setConnectionIpAuth
blocks.description: Sets the connection given by connectionId to use IP-based authentication. This will remove any other authentication type set for the connection. Please note that authorized IP addresses are not added through this endpoint.

blocks.name: updateConnectionIpAuthMethod
blocks.description: Update the IP authentication strategy used for authenticating the given connection

args.name: ipAuthenticationMethod
args.info: The method of IP authentication to use along with the connection. Defaults to tech-prefix. Can be tech-prefix, token or p-charge-info

blocks.name: getConnectionIpAuthTokenSuggestion
blocks.description: Gets a suggestion for a token to use with the IP authentication method token for the connection specified by connection_id. This is not 'binding' you can use a value other than one returned by this endpoint as a token. It is provided as a convenient way of getting a randomly generated token for a connection using that authentication method.

blocks.name: listAuthorizedIps
blocks.description: Returns all Authorized IPs the user has access to

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of results to load

blocks.name: createAuthorizedIp
blocks.description: Creates a new Authorized IP.

blocks.name: updateAuthorizedIp
blocks.description: Updates existing Authorized IP.

blocks.name: deleteAuthorizedIp
blocks.description: Deletes existing Authorized IP.

blocks.name: listE911Addresses
blocks.description: Returns all E911 Addresses the user has access to

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of results to load

blocks.name: createE911Address
blocks.description: Creating an E911 Address requires the address fields to exactly match E911 Service records. All capital letters, and no punctuation is generally sufficient.

args.name: firstName
args.info: Required if business name not given

args.name: lastName
args.info: Required if business name not given

args.name: businessName
args.info: Required if personal name not given

blocks.name: getSingleE911Address
blocks.description: Gets a single E911 Address based on the ID supplied.

blocks.name: updateE911Address
blocks.description: Updates a single E911 Address based on the ID supplied.

args.name: firstName
args.info: Required if business name not given

args.name: lastName
args.info: Required if business name not given

args.name: businessName
args.info: Required if personal name not given

blocks.name: deleteE911Address
blocks.description: Deletes a single E911 Address based on the ID supplied.

blocks.name: listNumbers
blocks.description: Returns all numbers that the user has access to.

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of results to load

args.name: filterTag
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, only numbers that have been tagged ã€€with the string given will be returned. Returns exact matches only.

args.name: filterNumberVal
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, only numbers that at least partially match the value given in their number will be returned. Requires at least three digits. Non-numerical characters should not be present in the filter and will result in no values being returned.

args.name: filterStatus
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, only numbers that have the same status as specified will be returned.

args.name: filterConnectionName
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, only numbers that have a connection that at least partially matches the string given will be returned. Matching is not case-sensitive. Requires at least three characters. Numbers without a connection will not be returned.

args.name: filterUsagePaymentMethod
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, only numbers that have the filterUsagePaymentMethod that at matches the string given will be returned. Matching is case-sensitive and only specified values are allowed.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Specify an ordering for the results.

args.name: sortDirection
args.info: The sort_direction specifies in which way the ordering of the connections is applied.

blocks.name: getSingleNumber
blocks.description: Retrieve a single number - ID supplied can be the telephone number (ex: +12124567890) or object ID

blocks.name: updateSingleNumber
blocks.description: Updates a single number - ID supplied can be the telephone number (ex: +12124567890) or object ID

args.name: primaryFqdn
args.info: The primary domain name for the number. Only relevant for numbers using a connection of FQDN-based authentication.

args.name: secondaryFqdn
args.info: The secondary domain name for the number. Only relevant for numbers using a connection of FQDN-based authentication.

args.name: tertiaryFqdn
args.info: The tertiary domain name for the number. Only relevant for numbers using a connection of FQDN-based authentication.

args.name: forwardsTo
args.info: The number that this number should be forwarded to; when this is set, forwardingType must also be set

args.name: forwardingType
args.info: sets when this number should have its calls forwarded; valid values are 'always' and 'on-failure'

args.name: enableCallerIdName
args.info: If true, enables sending of CNAME information for incoming calls to the number

args.name: usagePaymentMethod
args.info: setting for whether a number is billed per minute or uses your concurrent channels. Can be pay-per-minute or channel

args.name: enableRtpAutoAdjust
args.info: When RTP Auto-Adjust is enabled, the destination RTP address port will be automatically changed to match the source of the incoming RTP packets.

args.name: mediaHandlingMode
args.info: default: media routed through Telnyx with transcode support. proxy: media routed through Telnyx with no transcode support. bypass: media routed directly between origination and termination endpoints. Only Telnyx support may set a number to bypass mode.Can be default, proxy or bypass

args.name: routingMethod
args.info: The method for selecting the next connection IP address to use when dispatching calls for the number. This value has no effect for numbers that are not on a connection using IP authentication.Can be sequential or round-robin

args.name: cnamListingEnabled
args.info: Enable CNAM listings for this number. Requires cnamListingDetails to also be filled in. Changes to this must be reviewed by Telnyx support and will not be active until this process is complete.

args.name: cnamListingDetails
args.info: The CNAM listing details for this number. Must be alphanumeric characters or spaces with a maximum length of 15. Requires cnamListingEnabled to also be set. Changes to this must be reviewed by Telnyx support and will not be active until this process is complete.

args.name: t38FaxGatewayEnabled
args.info: If true, fax gateway is enabled

args.name: acceptAnyRtpPacketsEnabled
args.info: If true, accepts any rtp packets

args.name: tagList
args.info: Array of tags for this number

blocks.name: updateNumbers
blocks.description: Update multiple numbers at once

args.name: numberIds
args.info: Array of number ids and/or number values to update

args.name: forwardsTo
args.info: The number that this number should be forwarded to; when this is set, forwardingType must also be set

args.name: forwardingType
args.info: sets when this number should have its calls forwarded; valid values are 'always' and 'on-failure'

args.name: usagePaymentMethod
args.info: setting for whether a number is billed per minute or uses your concurrent channels. Can be pay-per-minute or channel

args.name: enableRtpAutoAdjust
args.info: When RTP Auto-Adjust is enabled, the destination RTP address port will be automatically changed to match the source of the incoming RTP packets.

args.name: mediaHandlingMode
args.info: default: media routed through Telnyx with transcode support. proxy: media routed through Telnyx with no transcode support. bypass: media routed directly between origination and termination endpoints. Only Telnyx support may set a number to bypass mode.Can be default, proxy or bypass

args.name: t38FaxGatewayEnabled
args.info: If true, fax gateway is enabled

args.name: acceptAnyRtpPacketsEnabled
args.info: If true, accepts any rtp packets

args.name: tagList
args.info: Array of tags for this number

blocks.name: checkUpdateRequest
blocks.description: Get status of mass numbers update

args.name: updateRequestId
args.info: Id of the mass numbers update request

blocks.name: enableE911OnNumber
blocks.description: Enable E911 - ID supplied can be the telephone number (ex: +12124567890) or object ID

blocks.name: deleteNumber
blocks.description: Deletes number - ID supplied can be the telephone number (ex: +12124567890) or object ID

blocks.name: getConcurrentChannelSettings
blocks.description: Get your concurrent channel settings

blocks.name: updateConcurrentChannelSettings
blocks.description: Update your concurrent channel settings

args.name: channels
args.info: The new number of concurrent channels you want. You may check the cost per channel on the pricing page. Please note you may not set your channel count to 0 if you have any numbers using channel billing.

blocks.name: createNumberOrder
blocks.description: Creates a number order. All numbers included in the order should have appeared in a NumberSearch within 1 day ago.

structure.name: requestedNumberWithMetadata
structure.info: JSON object with number and metadata

args.name: requestedInexplicitNumbers

structure.name: requestedInexplicitNumber
structure.info: JSON object with explicit number properties

args.info: JSON object with explicit number properties

blocks.name: createNumberSearch
blocks.description: Creates number search

args.name: searchDescriptor
args.info: JSOn object with search descriptor of proper type

blocks.name: getNumberSearch
blocks.description: Get number search status

blocks.name: listOutboundProfiles
blocks.description: Returns all Outbound Profiles the user has access to

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of results to load

blocks.name: createOutboundProfile
blocks.description: Creates a new Outbound Profile.

args.name: translationRule
args.info: Only configure if advised by Telnyx support

args.name: ports
args.info: Must be no more than your concurrent call limit. Null means no limit.

args.name: filterUsagePaymentMethod
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, only numbers that have the filterUsagePaymentMethod that at matches the string given will be returned. Matching is case-sensitive and only specified values are allowed.

blocks.name: getOutboundProfile
blocks.description: Gets a single Outbound Profile based on the ID supplied.

blocks.name: updateOutboundProfile
blocks.description: Updates a single Outbound Profile based on the ID supplied.

args.name: translationRule
args.info: Only configure if advised by Telnyx support

args.name: ports
args.info: Must be no more than your concurrent call limit. Null means no limit.

args.name: filterUsagePaymentMethod
args.info: Optional filtering parameter. If present, only numbers that have the filterUsagePaymentMethod that at matches the string given will be returned. Matching is case-sensitive and only specified values are allowed.

blocks.name: deleteOutboundProfile
blocks.description: Deletes a single Outbound Profile based on the ID supplied.

blocks.name: checkPhoneNumberPortability
blocks.description: Check a list of numbers to see if they're portable.

blocks.name: listPortRequests
blocks.description: Returns all port requests that your user has access to

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of results to load

args.name: search
args.info: Filter results by supportkey (pr*) or partial phone number

args.name: includePhoneNumbers
args.info: Include phone number objects in the results

args.name: includeSubRequests
args.info: Include sub request objects in the results

blocks.name: getSinglePortRequest
blocks.description: Returns a single port request based on the id supplied

args.name: includePhoneNumbers
args.info: Include phone number objects in the results

args.name: includeSubRequests
args.info: Include sub request objects in the results

blocks.name: getSubrequestsForPortRequest

blocks.name: submitDraftPortRequest
blocks.description: Once all of the sub requests belonging to a draft port request are populated with required information the draft port request can be submitted, initiating the porting process. Once successfully submitted changes can no longer be made to the draft port request.

args.name: draftPortRequestId
args.info: Id of the draft port request

blocks.description: Get the sub requests for a given draft port request

blocks.description: Update a sub request belonging to the given draft port request id

args.name: draftPortRequestId
args.info: Id of the draft port request

args.name: focDateRequestedByUser
args.info: Date/Time requested for the FOC date

args.name: personOrCompanyName
args.info: Person Name or Company name requesting the port

args.name: authPersonName
args.info: Name of person authorizing the port request

args.name: billingPhoneNumber
args.info: Billing phone number associated with these phone numbers

args.name: administrativeArea
args.info: Two character state abbreviation of billing address

args.name: countryCode
args.info: ISO3166-1 alpha-2 country code of billing address

args.name: defaultConnectionId
args.info: ID of connection to set on the numbers when ported

args.name: portingOptionType
args.info: A port can be either 'full' or 'partial'. When type is 'full' the other attributes should be ommitted.

args.name: remainingNumbersAction
args.info: Remaining numbers can be either kept with their current service provider or disconnected. 'newBillingPhoneNumber' is required when 'remainingNumbersAction' is 'keep'.

args.name: newBillingPhoneNumber
args.info: New billing telephone numbers for the remaining numbers. This will be set on your account with your current service provider and should be one of the numbers remaining on that account.

args.name: pinPasscode
args.info: PIN/passcode for accounts that have wireless type numbers

args.name: accountNumber
args.info: The authorized person's account number with the current service provider

args.name: taxIdentifier
args.info: European tax identification number. Applicable only in the European Union

args.name: businessIdentifier
args.info: European business identification number. Applicable only in the European Union
